message.content:
1. Post-operative VRS scores at 6, 12, and 24 hours were significantly decreased.
2. The decrease in VRS scores was observed in subjects prescribed morphine.
3. The decrease in VRS scores was also observed in subjects prescribed tramadol.
4. The decrease in VRS scores was compared with previous scores.
5. The decrease in VRS scores was significant (P < 0.001).
6. Both morphine and tramadol are local analgesics.
7. Both morphine and tramadol can significantly reduce pain after minor knee surgery.

messages.content:
Statement: Post-operative VRS scores at 6, 12, and 24 hours were significantly decreased when compared with previous scores in both morphine and tramadol prescribed subjects (P < 0.001), hence, both local analgesics can significantly reduce pain after minor knee surgery.

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
